list.name: yum
list.query: SELECT * FROM telegraf.short_term."lp.sys.yum" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter limit 10

list.name: messages
list.query: SELECT * FROM telegraf.short_term."lp.sys.messages" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter limit 10

targets.query: SELECT mean("usage_iowait") FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("usage_system") FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("usage_user") FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT 100-min("available_percent") FROM "mem" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT max("used_percent") FROM "swap" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("blocked") FROM "processes" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface
SELECT mean("running") FROM "processes" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface
SELECT mean("paging") FROM "processes" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface
SELECT mean("sleeping") FROM "processes" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface

panels.content:
# Help
Each row of this dashboard displays graphs with processes grouped using diffrerent methods.  
This row is a global server view to help see at a glance if a server is in trouble. Next rows should help you find the culprit.  
Note: RAM: the used % shown here is not counting reclaimable memory (like cache of buffers).
panels.title: Server view

targets.query: SELECT mean("cpu") FROM /pf[.]wl[.].*/ WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT max("rss") FROM /pf[.]wl[.].*/ WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT max("swap") FROM /pf[.]wl[.].*/ WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("process_nb") FROM /pf[.]wl[.].*/ WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)

panels.title: Number of processes by workload  on $Host

targets.query: SELECT mean("iobps") FROM /pf[.]wl[.].*/ WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)

panels.content:
A workload is a group of processes matching a set of (exclusive) rules.  
eg:  
- root: all UID 0 processes not yet in a workload.
- _other: all processes not yet in a workload.
panels.title: by workload?

targets.query: SELECT mean("cpu") FROM "pf.top.by.user.cpu" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"user"

panels.title: Top CPU usage % by user on $Host

targets.query: SELECT max("rss") FROM "pf.top.by.user.rss" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"user"

panels.title: Top Resident memory by user on $Host

targets.query: SELECT max("swap") FROM "pf.top.by.user.swap" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"user"

panels.title: Top Swap used by user on $Host

targets.query: SELECT mean("process_nb") FROM "pf.top.by.user.process_nb" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"user"

panels.title: Top Number of processes by user on $Host

targets.query: SELECT mean("iobps") FROM "pf.top.by.user.iobps" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"user"

panels.title: Top IO byte/s by user on $Host

panels.content:
Find the top resource intensive users.  
The _other.top.* aggregates other processes not owned by the top 5 (or 3) users.
panels.title: by user?

targets.query: SELECT mean("cpu") FROM "pf.top.by.cmd.cpu" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"cmd"

panels.title: Top CPU usage % by command on $Host

targets.query: SELECT max("rss") FROM "pf.top.by.cmd.rss" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"cmd"

panels.title: Top Resident memory by command on $Host

targets.query: SELECT max("swap") FROM "pf.top.by.cmd.swap" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"cmd"

panels.title: Top Swap used by command on $Host

targets.query: SELECT mean("thread_nb") FROM "pf.top.by.cmd.thread_nb" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"cmd"

panels.title: Top Number of threads  by command on $Host

targets.query: SELECT mean("iobps") FROM "pf.top.by.cmd.iobps" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"cmd"

panels.title: Top IO byte/s by command on $Host

panels.content:
Find the top resource intensive commands.  
The _other.top.* aggregates other processes not in the top 5 (or 3) commands.
panels.title: by command?

targets.query: SELECT mean("load1") FROM "system" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("load5") FROM "system" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("load15") FROM "system" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("active") FROM "mem" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT mean("total") FROM "mem" WHERE "host" = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("out"), 1s) FROM "swap" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(20s)
SELECT  non_negative_derivative(last("in"), 1s) FROM "swap" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(20s)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("bytes_recv"), 1s) FROM "net" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("bytes_sent"), 1s) FROM "net" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),interface
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("read_bytes"),1s) FROM "diskio" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"name"
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("write_bytes"),1s) FROM "diskio" WHERE host = '$Host' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval),"name"

panels.content:
Load: number of processes in the run queue.  
Active memory: frequetly accessed RAM.  
Swap: RAM pages read/write to disk.
panels.title: activity?

targets.query: SELECT last("os") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("bh") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("rh") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("cpu_model") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("cpu_nb") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("kernel") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT lastt("install_date") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h
SELECT last("cpu_nb") FROM "server_info" WHERE host='$Host' AND time > now() - 48h

panels.content:
These graphs should help you check the server activity with a fine time resolution (one sample every 10s or 20s).Data retention is only two weeks so old data are not available at this resolution.
See the 'Openos long term' link at the top right of this page for older data with a coarser one hour resolution.  
If you want more graphs (about file systems, network, ...) please click on 'Openos details' link at the top right of this page.  
Feel free to contact DI VB ME for help (BP\_METRO\_DGSI)
panels.title: Help

list.name: Host
list.query: show tag values from telegraf.short_term.mem with key=host
